title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Act includes amendments to section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, such as removing the phase-in of concurrent receipt and repealing certain provisions related to retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to allow military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The amendments include redesignating subsections and adjusting retired pay for disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. The amendment allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently if the retired pay exceeds a certain percentage of the member's years of service multiplied by the retired pay base. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. An amendment was made to allow combat-related special compensation eligibility for military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. An amendment was made to allow combat-related special compensation eligibility for military retirees with less than 20 years of service, as outlined in the amendments to section 1413a of title 10, United States Code. The amendment allows for a reduction in payment for retired military members if their retired pay exceeds a certain amount based on years of service. The effective date for these changes is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act.
